title: Frank Warren tells Derek Chisora to 'kiss his backside' after boxer labels promoter a 'dinosaur'
text:
Boxing promoter Frank Warren has told Derek Chisora to 'kiss his backside' after the heavyweight labelled him a 'dinosaur'.

Chisora hit out at Warren in an unprovoked verbal attack ahead of his fight with David Price on October 26.

Warren and Chisora have worked together earlier in the fighter's career but that didn't stop Warren from responding with a verbal volley of his own.

Frank Warren says Derek Chisora can 'kiss my backside' after the fighter called him a 'dinosaur'

Chisora unleashed an unprovoked verbal attack on his former promoter last week

Chisora is currently preparing for his British dust-up with David Price on October 26

'This dinosaur will be there with the heavyweight champion in Daniel Dubois when he [Chisora] is well and truly gone,' Warren told IFL TV.

'Both guys (Chisora and David Price) turned down the opportunity to fight Daniel Dubois.

'One of them loses and it could be the end of their career. The future of heavyweight boxing is with the dinosaur. That's where he's at.

Warren has accused Chisora and Price of ducking a fight with heavyweight Daniel Dubois

'This dinosaur will be around a little bit longer, so he shouldn't worry about it. As for the nonsense comments he makes, it is what it is.

'He should really come and kiss my backside for what I've done for him in this career.'

Chisora has won four of his last five fights, including a stunning knockout of Artur Szpilka in his last bout.

The north London-based heavyweight was due to face former Anthony Joshua foe, Joseph Parker, next before the New Zealander pulled out through illness.

He will now face Price, who stopped David Allen back in May, at the 02 in what promises to be a bloody British battle.
description: Boxing promoter Frank Warren has told Derek Chisora to 'kiss his backside' and accused him of ducking a fight with Daniel Dubois after the heavyweight labelled him a 'dinosaur'.
